title: Keir Starmer's Big Year Ahead
summary: Keir Starmer is the leader of the Labour Party and became prime minister after winning a big election. But now, just 18 months later, people are talking about whether he will stay as prime minister next year. This is surprising because he has a strong majority in government. The reason for this talk is that there are important elections coming up in May 2026 for places like Wales, Scotland, and local councils in England. If Labour does poorly in these elections, it could hurt Starmer's position. Some Labour members are worried and are quietly planning for what might happen. Even people in other countries are noticing this situation. Starmer himself has joked about the speculation, but it shows that 2026 is a critical year for him.

background_read: Keir Starmer is a British politician who became prime minister after leading the Labour Party to a big win in the general election. In the UK, the prime minister is the head of the government and makes important decisions. Elections are held regularly to choose leaders, and having a majority means one party has more power in parliament. The year 2026 is important because there will be elections in different parts of the UK, which could affect Starmer's leadership if his party doesn't do well.
Article_Structure: WHO: Keir Starmer, the prime minister and leader of the Labour Party
WHAT: People are speculating about whether he will remain prime minister due to upcoming elections in 2026
WHERE: In the UK, including Wales, Scotland, and local councils in England
WHY: Because if Labour performs poorly in these elections, it could threaten Starmer's position and lead to planning for his replacement
